0AE023E8B7AA4C33A43E53E1E7265FFA.description: Co-construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self-evaluation form or peer-evaluation form) and use it to assess the process and products involved in one’s student-directed study.

B5838249FC8D4CE8A765927AD46D513A.description: Share the results of student-directed inquiry through research paper, display, presentation, performance, demonstration, representation, or video.

05E605B38DD04943B9DF2A978BCBFCFC.description: Explore one or more topics such as: analyze and compare the impact of one factor (e.g., culture, parenting) influencing biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual development from infancy through adulthood; investigate and compare child parenting from various cultural perspectives; investigate and evaluate, based on student-created criteria (e.g. accessibility, cost, location, approaches), community resources that help individuals develop resiliency; investigate why and how individuals learn differently and discuss implications of labeling people’s abilities; investigate theories and concepts related to brain hemispheric dominance; compare key concepts of different attachment theories (e.g., maternal deprivation theory, attachment styles); investigate major theoretical perspectives and research methods from various cultural perspectives related to lifespan; assemble and reflect on a portfolio that demonstrates an understanding of a career choice by interviewing or job shadowing for a specific psychology related occupation (e.g., roles, responsibilities and skills, education level required including licensing requirement in Saskatchewan, salary and benefits; and, work environment, workplace hazards and safety considerations, financial outlook and future trends impacting the occupation).

25EB1AF744834ACA9613A5F7ACE69CB8.description: Examine validity, reliability and ethical issues in various quantitative and qualitative research methods (e.g., experimental, interview, observation, case study) used in psychology.

3DDB2C6679CE4B5B97C3A668B8120E49.description: Design and carry out a detailed exploration of one or more topics of personal interest relevant to Psychology 30using an ethical perspective.

2CA434859BB243069C2F8CF2BDAF3BA0.description: Research the implications of organ donations and organ transplants for individuals and their families.

76E3C4F9CB55450BBC400498275F52FC.description: Investigate and compare current and past studies which reflect various viewpoints and/or theories regarding nature and nurture.

F42151CBBDCE450CBC3553257C854A59.description: Explore issues involved in transitioning from dependent child into independent adult (e.g., living on your own, post-secondary schooling and/or work responsibilities, financial stresses, boomerang children, establishing adult relationships, responsibility to parents/caregivers versus self-responsibility).

DA87330F8F1C4E029EB00D964E8D5D93.description: Investigate an issue of personal interest related to pre-adolescence (e.g. , ages 10-12) including biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual aspects.

93BC2DDC93204056A34BFE1C66EA4007.description: Conduct an inquiry into any of the following topics focusing on the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual): gender development and sexual diversity (e.g., gender neutral language, sexual orientation, gender neutral parenting); technological, ethical, legal and/or moral issues surrounding topics such as fertility/infertility, alternative methods of conception, surrogates, genetic engineering; heredity traits passed from one generation to the next; historical shifts and controversies regarding conception, differing opinions of when life begins, abortion issues and infanticide; various expenses involved with, and estimated cost of, raising a child from birth to adulthood; and, implications of birth order of children, single child in a family or cultural child rearing practices (e.g., raised by entire community, raised by grandparents) and how this impacts own life.

5322FB8679B447E582524177CE051488.description: Determine the connections between one’s personality, lifestyle, health and relationships.

E1E04651C67148FAB8F17FAFBFD269C7.description: Conduct an inquiry into the definition of personality and determine if aspects of one’s personality continue to develop during a lifespan.

6316495194CE49679AB763135F4B45B9.description: Debate when old age starts and discuss various cross-cultural attitudes towards aging.

E3B946A743B84F3D8C91E04504F8CB0D.description: Analyze the pros and cons (e.g., medical, emotional) of postponing motherhood/pregnancy to establish one’s career.

0FB9F2CB012B4C02A930EF839DDB673C.description: Explore the emotional and physical effects of grandparents becoming primary care givers for their grandchildren and research available community supports

31C5360FADF8423C955DF93C765C78C7.description: Examine the strengths and challenges of becoming new parents at different stages (e.g., 20s, 40s, 60s) of life.

063A2D5E78484D50805A329AE205F125.description: Determine stressors parents face and research resiliency and coping skills they can develop to maintain balanced and healthy lives.

CD8DA8FACD9749DB9900F7481CE6155A.description: Examine some issues and challenges (e.g., financial, mental and physical well-being, cognition, retirement, relationships) seniors face and consider potential solutions.

1D5A65C41B984B53841B815154E930FC.description: Explore the meaning of the phrase “living beyond one’s means” and the effects this can have on one’s physical and mental well-being.

10D1B50B8BFE412581070935269E0B56.description: Conduct an inquiry into various cultural influences on one’s perceptions of death and dying.

937B6C8C7EB04EAAB7AE162698AE44E5.description: Examine causes and affects of divorce on couples and their families.

76F34955803143728C57D920B5DB6E4A.description: Explore how adverse childhood experiences (e.g., abuse, death of caregiver, divorce, caregiver incarceration, abandonment) influence choices and behaviour in adult life.

0980A3E8677A49C584F04E98B358CE62.description: Research various relationship trends, processes and moral and legal commitments.

0EC7BFB153CC4151B137F9F0B46E1D00.description: Research influence of substance misuse on cognitive, biological, spiritual well-being and identify reasons why some people may be susceptible to addiction.

CF3E8AB9EF1B49289204C4DD2C9B1B27.description: Analyze the influences of various lifestyle choices (e.g., nutrition, exercise, substance abuse, how one chooses to handle stress, deceitfulness in a relationship) on the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional, spiritual) during adulthood.

CD35834BD50845249E7914B3D904091C.description: Investigate various sociocultural factors that influence adulthood.

0AB514B730F74A6381684970122CBD76.description: Analyze relationships between personality, lifestyle and health and discuss implications for own life.

101777C07D684048BF24C7F1347E2726.description: Assess influences of childhood traumas (e.g., war, violence, abuse, neglect, attachment issues, exposure to or witnessing substance misuse, family isolation, poverty) on adult development and lifestyle.

3212D4330D9141409B53586BACC4E702.description: Create a representation (e.g., essay, letter, comic strip, magazine advertisement) that supports a positive quote about aging (e.g., “Getting old is like climbing a mountain; you get a little out of breath, but the view is much better!”, Ingrid Bergman), based on two dimensions.

3D920CBF0B684A5CBEA23AED43101894.description: Create a written piece (e.g. interview of a senior citizen about their current life, series of personal daily journal entries 50 years in the future, letter to one’s future senior self) that details daily life as a member of the older generation.

FD8B6A8941EE4F12BFF5A13422D012E4.description: Examine the impacts of change as one transitions through different experiences (e.g., moving away from home, entering the work force, becoming a parent, retiring) in a lifespan.

2618A28A5A924C70B6F5ABFB98EDE83E.description: Examine biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual changes, challenges and benefits during the aging process.

0C9447BFEA784109954A68BAB2F494BC.description: Explore the benefits of holistic approaches (i.e., interconnected mind, body, spirit, emotion) to lifespan development.

88C1A110116D4302A4CE5C93987060B9.description: Investigate historical and contemporary perspectives (e.g., First Nations and Métis traditional worldviews, psychoanalytic, behavioural, sociocultural, psychosocial) on human development.

E96D40837AEE4A96B310FD2C3E05370B.description: Examine interconnectedness of the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional, spiritual) of the whole person through lifespan development.

8B93DD3C747B4E42AD01ABA932CD8F1F.description: Investigate explanations for elements of cognition (e.g. learning, memory, imagination, judgement, decision-making) shared through oral storytelling.

AA4A30B4422241F49214F138E3FD0E73.description: Create a representation (e.g., mind map, cluster diagram, 3D model, mobile, game, song) depicting one’s learning style strengths.

1D1410114EB8449882570071D619A7A4.description: Distinguish differences among learning styles theories (e.g., visual/spatial, logical/mathematical, kinesthetic) and examine their roles in learning and surrounding controversies.

77AFE4C9E8784A548A62DE55262A467E.description: Examine connections between cognition and memory (e.g., memory tools, dementia, Alzheimer’s, muscle memory).

E1EE8B01D5054CD38CC40215CE1DB249.description: Investigate what is meant by “adolescent egocentrism" and its effects on one’s life.

BFABF575C9C34AA2B20A0D342F0F3767.description: Examine developmental changes in cognition from childhood through adolescence.

A2E42DDC64AF41F8915F92072B249F8B.description: Investigate the development of the nervous system and the brain from birth to five years.

1C10B57B0E0C41D6A42F5453535F2653.description: Examine various historical and current cognitive development theories (e.g., Vygotsky, Piaget) and traditional Indigenous views of cognitive development.

242D6FDBE4D3489AA0C2EE7224DFD068.description: Examine cognition as it applies to lifespan development.

087562DC76C646839FC44DF9AEDEBF0B.description: Conduct an inquiry into how injuries, health conditions affecting the nervous and/or endocrine system and substance misuse can influence thoughts, feelings, perceptions and behaviour.

10936629DF8C49EABDA4A48CF317A4BE.description: Analyze the effects of traditional food diets (e.g., Western, Indigenous, South Asian, African, Mediterranean) vs. processed food diets and their impact on health and emotional well-being

40B5043FC18A4D8B9BEFE3365E394C90.description: Analyze the roles of nutrition and physical activity on thoughts, biological and emotional development.

698B4689AE094260AFB668B618FF7849.description: Examine ways emotions are connected to biological influences.

E7B0DB662FDB417DA0DADC46442B4F15.description: Design a visual (e.g., superhero or villain with nervous system enhancements or flaws) to represent similarities, differences and interconnectedness of the nervous and endocrine systems.

247CB2A94FB6442DAC73665DC7BD97EA.description: Identify parts and functions of the central nervous system (e.g., brain, spinal cord, neurons) and the endocrine system (e.g., thyroid, pituitary pancreas).

6AD4FD3BFDD24A72A53838F58C8DBD87.description: Investigate ways in which biological influences affect thoughts, feelings and emotions in relation to development.

D0A7B2E8731C47F3801D2082C27B2E64.description: Investigate influences of spiritual beliefs and cultural rites of passage (e.g., birth, intimacy, group behaviour, marriage, death) on individuals.

95FA1357817E4860B32890375EAE97F2.description: Examine emotional and social issues and challenges involved in becoming a parent (e.g., values, family genetic history, parenting styles, relationship stability, spiritual beliefs, parent age, finances).

0DAE03AF732847A9A8FB4604EDB95056.description: Investigate similarities and differences among stereotypes, prejudice and discrimination and discuss potential impact on adolescent development

A5999E4AB3A948ADB500CC0EF0200518.description: Analyze how an individual or groups may encounter obstacles (e.g., racial or gender privilege, ideals of beauty) within mainstream society that can impact their sense of agency and ability to achieve personal goals.

F894805D4E7942C987C0B2E800356BB7.description: Examine development of agency (i.e., acting independently and making own choices) and co-agency (i.e., interactive, mutually supportive relationships) in adolescence.

AEB42486352E4AA29D981B3EA38326CA.description: Research how individuals form social perceptions, make sense of behaviours of others and form judgements about other people.

E355DEC2403E457FA6D07566D06E4F28.description: Analyze influences (e.g., cultural, gender, family, peers, media, poverty) on self-concept.

6D87B326944E4B77B460322A755D6BD8.description: Investigate ways sociocultural environments influence adolescent development.

608FF74C2624485FBC6C24A836713A8D.description: Create a representation (e.g., drama, video, song, visual) demonstrating understanding of key changes from adolescence to early adulthood.

D4BAD12BD77C4FFB87CB718405949C53.description: Examine issues and challenges in adolescence (e.g., substance misuse, eating disorders, teen parenting, gender identity, teen violence, crime, bullying, self-harm, suicide).

85D2E7C538D14EB6A702805D59E424D5.description: Summarize and discuss key changes (e.g., biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual) in development from adolescence to early adulthood.

D6A7D752ADAC4B2682B08252A5FC5F20.description: Investigate factors that influence development of the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional, spiritual) from adolescence to early adulthood.

42C5637651A74A8FA8D95BF8B6269774.description: Explore the influence of biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual dimensions on the development of identity in childhood.

71A73094A351463498188FC5155B3370.description: Investigate the biological, cognitive and emotional benefits of unstructured creative play during childhood.

CC9E5160CC35406AADC30A235A91915A.description: Examine influences of culture on identity development.

BE15346F686B487A965532EB79DA84C7.description: Examine influences of parent-child interaction during significant life events (e.g., death, adoption, blended families, parental separation/divorce) on childhood development.

7E1C78F70DD347BFA74AFE9ED213DD08.description: Analyze the influences (e.g., child’s use, parent’s use) of technology on childhood development.

F54421D95F3B4FA5993DB4915B93CCE9.description: Investigate how various dynamics of a family have changed throughout history and creatively represent these dynamics (e.g., dramatic role play, song, illustrated timeline, fictional parenting blog).

E9247B7711E24F2896DFC05E532E79BE.description: Discuss Howard Gardner’s theory of Multiple Intelligences and connections to childhood development.

9F85DC463B6E4EFDAB4DC85B801CBA6C.description: AnalyzeJean Piaget’s four stages of cognitive development (i.e., sensorimotor, preoperational, concrete operational, formal operational) and their relationships to the four dimensions of development.

4160714DE32B4C4792C0150918AEFA45.description: Summarize and discuss key changes (e.g., biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual) indevelopment of children from 6 to 12 years.

D0FA5F37B7D947AAA267B145136045B2.description: Investigate factors that influence development of the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional, spiritual) from 6 to 12 years.

2E70D920CBFB40A19FCBE143417C13AB.description: Design and create a toy for a young child that develops cognition and fine motor skills.

A48AE6EF9715417FBAD950B0ADFB4304.description: Investigate criteria for toys available for young children (e.g., infants, toddlers, preschoolers)that develop gross and fine motor skills.

2C135823931C4F6CAC2837419724EBBA.description: Analyze the influences (e.g., child’s use, parent’s use) of technology on childhood development.

4F98A15C7E0647C6A166179D50997C14.description: Examine the influences of direct conversation (i.e., adult to child) on language development.

458D174C19574159853718C09464B6A2.description: Create a timeline of language development from ages birth to five years.

3FDAF176005C431DA1162990D0D795D7.description: Investigate stages of communication processes and language development in early childhood.

0D112EC7741F46EDBF2392FBA71B2682.description: Examine beginnings of personality in infants (e.g., temperament, early socialization, types of attachments, affects of social deprivation, bonding/attachment with parents).

2A376A63A3B54964B5635477D5C5B3A6.description: Compare effects of healthy and unhealthy lifestyles on fetal development.

F957B468136B44DC8288317C37CAD2A1.description: Examine stages of pregnancy and complications that can arise.

0C75FA7F0C4748DC883BA2D747B66F5E.description: Explore how family’s spiritual views (e.g., values, morals, beliefs) can impact the development of young children.

9F534E55E6B54EEFA6BDA02C765DCECA.description: Investigate sensory and perceptual systems from birth to five years.

873E253C3A744F04896CC3EE349699B0.description: Summarize processes of biological, cognitive and emotional development from conception to birth, infancy and early childhood.

2AE4FD0A3AEB4F96ACB34AAB8FB19864.description: Investigate factors that influence development of the four dimensions (i.e., biological, cognitive, emotional, spiritual) from conception to five years.

5C054082CBE84D979A3C09E65C2425D2.description: Investigate how trauma, from historical and current events (e.g., genocide, Residential Schools, Sixties Scoop, effects of poverty, racism), impacts biological, cognitive, socioemotional and spiritual development (e.g., epigenetic, intergenerational) of a child.

B4047BFDE3904A48BFCFB41FD9218D83.description: Analyze and compare roles of nature (e.g., hereditary traits, individual abilities and capacities) and nurture (e.g., environmental influences) that shape behaviour with lifespan development.

13EB43AF6F1F410BBB77CE90BA1084CE.description: Conduct an inquiry into how different cultures and perspectives view lifespan development (e.g., First Nations, Métis and Inuit, Black, Asian).

9D0E8E9342AA40AFBE03A8134B2D889D.description: Investigate ways individuals’ support systems (e.g., parents, foster parents, extended family caregivers, social, religious and cultural organizations, worldviews) influence thoughts, feelings and behaviour.

09CE8327CA884D2E8F68407CB5A5025B.description: Examine roles and influences (e.g., morals, prosocial and antisocial behaviour, motivation, discipline philosophies) of families, peers and significant others on lifespan development.

6BB121552E9C4B8494E6C5223BF94A32.description: Examine how biology, culture and spirituality might influence one’s gender identity.

7702965AA7D848D2A83782DA42EE9BD0.description: Investigate how gender identities can influence biological, cognitive, socioemotional and spiritual development during childhood.

48E64848F4E640DAB4F76F3021B828F4.description: Analyze aspects of human development that might be attributed exclusively to heredity or inherited factors.

8A2307BB6AB54074B9F08057DBDE4D4C.description: Investigate how biological (e.g., gross and fine motor skills), cognitive (e.g., thinking and memory), socioemotional (e.g., temperament) and spiritual (e.g., personal beliefs, value systems) aspects of development interact to support development of a child.

4872F8984D0848A186A8CB2F3DFDD3A4.description: Investigate theories of nature and nurture and the impact of biological, cognitive, emotional and spiritual factors on lifespan development.

30D06F338E344EFFA62144D122729B37.description: Explore how the practice of psychology has been used to maintain power imbalances in institutions across Canada.

15DFD1AB77FA457AB06072D88EED2FC7.description: Analyze the impacts of imposing concepts of Western social sciences on marginalized groups.

4143419D0E0F41629698B4C8BA834CE8.description: Analyze and discuss validity, reliability and ethical issues in various quantitative and qualitative research methods (e.g., experimental, interview, observation, case study) used in psychology.

B39B692A9D0546AFA4C951ED023811B4.description: Examine the roles of the four dimensions of human development (i.e., biological, cognitive, socioemotional, spiritual) in developmental psychology.

3B7FC6101E244E07987E403353293E90.description: Investigate developmental psychology as an evolving science.

D1C1E5DC25F84232A3490239A48561F7.description: Explore and compare historical shifts within Western European theoretical perspectives of psychology (e.g., psychodynamic, behavioural, cognitive, humanistic, evolutionary, sociocultural)using various cultural worldviews.

DA0E909D939941B39C94FEF10844C56A.description: Examine and compare various historical and current cognitive development theories, such as, First Nations and Métis Elders and Knowledge Keepers traditional ways of knowing and westerndevelopment theorists.

295E91ECFF8749169555871F44BF10C2.description: Examine historical shifts in psychology including major theoretical perspectives and research methods related to lifespan development using various culturalperspectives.
